Here\'s a place to relax and rationalise your thoughts when you feel stressed or feeling low. You will find 40+ tools like breathing exercises, guided meditations, relaxing music, food to eat or activities to do, venting or express through writing. Choose a technique that best suits and start feeling better!
Get Now
Get MY Complete Well Being Improvement Plan & Daily WorkOuts
Choose a technique that best works for you
Connectivity issue
Please check your data network

Positive affirmations help you overcome negative thoughts, feelings or beliefs by programming your mind into believing the stated concept. 
	A) You are presented with a set of affirmations on the screen with background subliminal music. Use earplugs and increase volume level if needed. 
	B) Read each affirmation loud. Say it as you believe it. 
	C) Think about what the words mean to you. 
	D) Visually experience a past or a future event or an imaginary one that supports the read affirmation.
Internet not available

1. Go to a quiet place or corner or just close the door of your room to make a private place for yourself. 
 2. Vent out your anger, sadness, hurt or any other painful emotions.
 3. Talk out about the situation, people or matter that has caused you pain. 
 4. Express your very deepest feelings, emotions and thoughts including the past pain. 
 5. Vent out whatever comes to you. Don't worry about language, grammar or tone of your voice.
 6. Focus on venting out all that's bothering you, till you feel lighter in your heart.
 7. Reflect on if there is a better way to respond to this situation 
 8. If possible, forgive the person.
 9. Click delete at the end, to destroy the file.
 10. After you click delete, go back to the person who have hurt you, express yourself in a cool and collected manner.

• Vent out your anger, sadness, hurt or any other painful emotions.

 • Talk out about the situation, people or matter that has caused you pain. 

 • Express your very deepest feelings, emotions and thoughts including the past pain.

• Reflect on if there is a better way to respond to this situation 

 • If possible, forgive the person.

 • Click delete at the end, to destroy the file.

 • After you click delete, go back to the person who have hurt you, express yourself in a cool and collected manner.
Journaling - to build deeper relations with partner, family, friends or peers.
Today\'s mindfulness practice - to deepen being in present moment without judgement.
Affirmations - to transform negative beliefs to more positive ones

This is the place to write and make journaling a habit. You can write down your biggest secrets, your dreams, desires, make a note of abundance, count your blessings, happy moments and express your pain - even the ones you cannot share with anyone else.
Identify a thing you are grateful about your workplace. It could be expressing gratitude for your talents being utilised, colleagues, boss or anything you feel valued, contributed and respected.

Identify the person whom you want to send your gratitude message to.\n Write a thank-you note expressing how much their contribution meant to you and how it helped or made you happy.\n Express your true feelings in as many words as possible rather a short note.
Hey, thanks for being there for me. It means a lot!
Email id
Write here
Write few things you appreciate in your-self. Write about the quality and attitude that brought a positive outcome or made others happy. Appreciate yourself for that completely.

Keep track of all the abundance in your life. It\'s like you wished for something to happen and magically it happened, without you putting much effort into it. Just note down such experiences. \nExample can be, something you wish to buy - someone gifted you, gave money, was available for free or on sale and you brought it. Or you get good marks without you working hard for it etc.
Write your dreams, desires and wishes you wish to manifest in your life in as much detail as possible. Remember, to also put the needed effort to manifest your dream life.
Write your feelings and deepest thought what is hurting you.
In your writing, really let go and explore your deepest emotions and thoughts.
Be it pain due to relationships with parents, spouse, friends or relatives; to your past, your present or your future; or to who you have been, who you would like to be or who you are now.
Do not worry about spelling, grammar or sentence structure. Write continuously for 15 to 20 minutes.
Start feeling better, healthier and uncover the sense of meaning in the experience.
Report an issue
Help
Capture your happy moments in the happiness journal.

Thank you for completing the wellbeing questionnaire. This report provides you with summary feedback about your current wellbeing in 8 relevant areas.

The report was produced by nSmiles. It has been derived from the results of a questionnaire completed by you, the respondent, and reflects the responses made by you. \nThe report provides your best wellbeing practices, areas that need improvement and immediate attention. At the end of the report, you will find tips to maintain and achieve optimal wellbeing. \nThis report has been generated electronically. nSmiles do guarantee that it has not been changed or edited. We can accept no liability for the consequences of the use of this report, howsoever arising.
TOP ACTIONS YOU MAY WANT TO TAKE IMMEDIATELY TO RESTORE WELLBEING QUICKLY
DETAILED REPORT

Here\'s the detailed explanation of each of the areas of well-being in the order of maximum to minimum percentages based on your responses. You will see details of explanation regarding the area of well-being, your score and the impact of it on wellbeing.
Let us work on your goal
How was your day? Make a note of one good thing / appreciate a person today!

Wellbeing, happiness & success are all closely inter-related. Here is your personal wellbeing assessment, personalised improvement plan and your daily workout coach in an App. To know what\'s causing your current situation, take this holistic wellbeing assessment across these 8 areas - physical, mental, social, finances, purpose, environmental, family and career wellbeing. View report
What is your feeling?
What made this moment happy for you.

You may want to follow these instructions
1. Give the event a title (e.g Friend complimented my work on a project)
2. Write down exactly what happened in as much detail as possible, including what you did or said and, if others were involved, what they did or said.
3. Include how this event made you feel at the time and how this event made you feel later (including now, as you remember it).
4. Explain what you think caused this event—why it happened.
5. Use whatever writing style you please, and do not worry about perfect grammar and spelling. Use as much detail as you did like.
6. If you find yourself focusing on negative feelings, refocus your mind on the good event and the positive feelings that came with it. This can take effort but gets easier with practice and can make a real difference in how you feel.

Situation: Write about something that went well or something that didn\'t go right or as planned. At this stage write what actually happened – no feelings, thoughts, reflections, or assumptions – just facts. Be concise, but write as much as you feel you need to. Incidents will vary in complexity and depth.
Affect: Think about the event and how it affected you personally. This could be positive or negative. Think about Why did you feel the way you did?

Interpretation: Think about, and then explain in what ways the new learning either confirms or contradicts your prior knowledge, theories, or understanding, in particular the knowledge you might have gained.

Decision: There is no point learning something if you don\’t store it away for future use. So what decision did you make to help you in future? What will you do better in future? \nReflection journal: There is no point in learning something if you don’t store it away for future use. What are 3 things you have learned today? Is there anything you could have done better.
Sad better calm confident motivated energised?
Something went wrong! Please try again.

Identify 3 things you are grateful for today. These 3 things can be events that occurred today, problems which could have happened but didn\’t happen, or simply things which have always been in your life but which you suddenly came to feel grateful for today.

Think of 3 reasons, you are thankful about the topic recommended. Appreciate what you have in life which otherwise you may be taking granted for. Express your thanks, however small or big it may seem.
